data.text: I saw that the righteous, and the wise,
There is this evil in all that is done under the sun,
For who is he that has fellowship with all the living?
For the living will know that they shall die:
Also their love, and their hatred,
Go, eat thy bread with mirth,
Let thy garments be always white;
And see life with the wife whom thou lovest
Whatsoever thy hand shall find to do,
I returned, and saw under the sun,
For surely man also knows not his time:
This I also saw to be wisdom under the sun,
Suppose there were a little city, and few men in it;
And should find in it a poor wise man,
And I said, Wisdom is better than power:
The words of the wise are heard in quiet
Wisdom is better than weapons of war:
